channel.title: BBC News - UK

item.title: Madeleine McCann: Parents welcome declaration of formal suspect
item.description: Madeleine McCann has been missing for nearly 15 years after she disappeared, aged three, in Portugal.

item.title: Ukraine: UK embassy in Kyiv to reopen next week, says PM
item.description: Boris Johnson announces the embassy in Ukraine is set to open its doors again after Russia's invasion.

item.title: Pension fraudsters jailed after £13m scam
item.description: Victims have lost a lifetime's pension savings, telling the BBC they have little hope of retiring.

item.title: Boris Johnson faces leadership criticism amid partygate row
item.description: Boris Johnson deflects questions over his future, but a senior Tory MP says a no confidence vote is likely.

item.title: Supermarkets set limits on sale of cooking oil
item.description: Tesco joins Waitrose and Morrisons in limiting purchases as supplies are hit by the conflict in Ukraine.

item.title: Coronavirus levels continue to fall across the UK
item.description: ONS officials say they are seeing welcome falls in infection across the UK, but levels remain high.

item.title: Colin Pitchfork: Parole hearing for double child killer and rapist
item.description: Colin Pitchfork will be considered for release again this autumn, it has been confirmed.

item.title: Hampshire football coach Alfie Morel jailed for child sex attacks
item.description: Alfie Morel, 24, had been well regarded by parents who trusted their children with him.

item.title: Bourne End: Three found dead in village were stabbed, say police
item.description: The victims had been knifed in the chest and stomach, post-mortem examinations find.

item.title: Hakeem Hussain: Mum guilty of manslaughter over fatal asthma attack
item.description: Seven-year-old Hakeem Hussain was found dead in a garden in freezing conditions.

item.title: Trio sentenced over Sandy Row riot
item.description: Two men have been jailed and a woman has received a suspended sentence linked to a riot in 2021.

item.title: Brexit: Boris Johnson not ruling out law to override protocol
item.description: Boris Johnson says he will continue talking to the EU to seek reforms, but won't rule out further steps.

item.title: UK elections 2022: A really simple guide
item.description: Local elections in England, Wales and Scotland, and a general election in Northern Ireland, will happen on 5 May.

item.title: May 2022 UK elections: How to vote
item.description: Voters are choosing councillors in England, Scotland and Wales, and a government in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Election 2022: Is there an election in my area?
item.description: National elections in Northern Ireland and local elections in the rest of the UK happen on 5 May 2022.

item.title: Local elections 2022: A simple guide to English council elections
item.description: Your introduction to the local council elections taking place on 5 May.

item.title: NI election 2022: Why Northern Ireland's election is different
item.description: Parties make pledges but the nature of Northern Ireland's government means they're harder to honour.

item.title: England local elections 2022: What's at stake for the parties?
item.description: Elections in England this year will reflect voters' views on the cost-of-living crisis, says the BBC's Alex Forsyth.

item.title: Hakeem Hussain: The needless death of a neglected boy
item.description: Hakeem Hussain's mother is found guilty of his manslaughter after prioritising her drug addiction.

item.title: Periods: TikTok gives better education than schools, say teens
item.description: Young women say they learn more about periods outside school as a report reveals shortcomings.

item.title: Have we had enough of Netflix?
item.description: The streaming giant is losing subscribers despite huge hits like Squid Game and Bridgerton.

item.title: Logan Mwangi: Who are Angharad Williamson and John Cole?
item.description: The trail of violence, lies and racism that led to five-year-old Logan Mwangi's murder is revealed.

item.title: Restaurants and pubs blacklist no-show customers
item.description: Customers failing to cancel bookings cost one pub £20,000, with no-shows now barred from booking.

item.title: Boris Johnson's India visit takes place against partygate backdrop
item.description: The prime minister enjoys an enthusiastic welcome abroad as his troubles at home persist.

item.title: Whisky and visas could be part of a UK-India trade deal
item.description: Boris Johnson is hoping to strike a free trade deal with India within months.

item.title: Rikki Neave: How killer James Watson was finally caught
item.description: How a mother once accused of murdering her son helped bring his killer to justice.

item.title: 'A great sense of humour': But what makes the Queen laugh?
item.description: As she turns 96, the Queen's sense of humour is hailed as an important, if often hidden, quality.

item.title: 'Sip and shop': The retailers tempting you in with alcohol
item.description: A small but growing number of High Street stores are offering customers a glass of wine.

item.title: Did lockdown prompt a break-up with make-up?
item.description: A survey of 10,000 British women by retail analyst Kantar has revealed big changes to beauty routines.

item.title: What did Boris Johnson tell Parliament about parties?
item.description: MPs are set to investigate whether the prime minister misled Parliament.

item.title: Covid: What is the guidance on mask-wearing now?
item.description: Almost all of the UK's Covid rules have ended, two years after they were introduced.

item.title: 'People fear for their jobs if they report bullies'
item.description: Bafta-winning director Brian Hill on tackling bullying in his industry with new film Toxic.

item.title: Premier League: Can Fulham succeed in the top flight under Marco Silva?
item.description: Up, down, up, down, up... is this the time Fulham finally avoid the drop and achieve Premier League survival?

item.title: NI election 2022: Campaigners say change needed to get more women into Stormont
item.description: A record number of women are standing in the NI election - but more needs to change, say campaigners.

item.title: Are there affordable ways to cut your heating bill?
item.description: Alternatives to gas and oil heating are becoming more popular but are still expensive.

item.title: Partygate: Which Downing Street parties have resulted in fines so far?
item.description: The police inquiry is separate to the investigation carried out by civil servant Sue Gray.

item.title: Harry Billinge: The veteran who raised £50,000 for a D-Day memorial
item.description: The funeral of Harry Billinge, who raised £50,000 for a D-Day memorial in Arromanches, takes place next week.

item.title: Westminster Abbey will open roof for first time to celebrate Platinum Jubilee
item.description: The tours, which are to celebrate the Platinum Jubilee, will run from June to August this summer.

item.title: The Queen's Guard play Happy Birthday to celebrate Queen's 96th birthday
item.description: The Queen's Guard play an arrangement of Happy Birthday during the Changing of the Guard ceremony.

item.title: Is this the oldest uneaten Easter egg?
item.description: Sally's brother Ron bought her the Easter Egg with his first pay packet in 1971.

item.title: PMQs: Does PM want to apologise to archbishop? - Starmer
item.description: Keir Starmer accuses the PM of "slandering" the Archbishop of Canterbury over immigration comments.

item.title: War in Ukraine: A separated family reunited
item.description: The Chumak family thought they would never be all together again after Peter got stuck in Ukraine.

item.title: Luton flats fire: Man who died had fallen from window, say police
item.description: Officers discovered the blaze in Luton after going to investigate a suspected arsonist, police say.

item.title: Anglesey: Woman's death treated as suspicious by police
item.description: A person is in custody after the woman's body was discovered in a property on Anglesey.

item.title: Covid cases in Scotland fall by 30,000 in a week
item.description: It is the fourth week in a row the number of positives tests has dropped, according to official figures.

item.title: Covid-19: Free PCR tests to end for most people in NI
item.description: Lateral flow tests remain free for those displaying Covid symptoms or visiting high-risk settings.

item.title: Neglect contributed to baby's death, coroner finds
item.description: Cassian Curry's parents say their son, who died in April 2021, was a "beacon of light".
